battle

Class Status

  • java.lang.Object
    • battle.Status
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TurnItem

    public class Status
extends java.lang.Object
implements TurnItem
    A state that can be applied to Fighter objects through the execution of Skill objects. All Status objects have a name field that is used to identify its equivalence. Status objects with the same name can be applied to the same fighter so as to stack, either in magnitude or duration.
    Author:
    Andrew M. Teller(https://github.com/AndrewMiTe)
    See Also:
    StatusBuilder

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private class  Status.Stack
      Used within this class to track when to decrement the stack size of the status when it combined with Status objects that have a finite in duration and are stackable.

      • Status

        public Status(Status copyOf)
        Initializes a copy of the given Status object such that direct changes to the state of either the original or the copy has no affect on the other. Some copied parameters are purposefully not deep. It is assumed that all StatusHandler objects passed to handle events should be copied by reference so as not to duplicate potentially large listeners. Predicate objects passed to test various conditions are also copied by reference and therefore must be immutable in regards to its test method. A copy is based on the stack size and duration of when the the status was first created. Copies are always without an owner, even if the original has one, thus making the value always null.
        Parameters:
        copyOf - object which the copy is made from.

    • Method Detail

      • builder

        public static StatusBuilder builder(java.lang.String name)
        Returns a new StatusBuilder object using the name property of the given String.
        Parameters:
        name - name property of status to be built. See StatusBuilder.setName(java.lang.String)
        Returns:
        new instance of a status builder.

      • canCombine

        public final boolean canCombine(Status status)
        Returns true if the the given Status object can be legally combined with this object. A legal status must first be equivalent by having the same name value. The two objects are checked to see if their duration values are either both instant, both infinite, or both finite. Mismatched flags for stacks, defeats, stuns, and hidden values results in a false return value. See combineWith for a description of what happens when two statuses are successfully combined.
        Parameters:
        status - the status to test.
        Returns:
        true if the given status can combine with this one.

      • combineWith

        public final void combineWith(Status status)
        Takes a Status object that can legally combine with this status and incorporates many properties, including stack size, duration, and listeners whenever applicable. When the isStackable method returns true for this status, the stack size of the given status is combined with this. In addition, if this status is finite in duration, the given status is incorporated so that the stack size may decrement at varying intervals, based on the durations of the incorporated status and this. If this status is finite and not stackable, then the duration of the given status is added to this. In all cases this will inherit any StatusHandler objects listening to the given Status object that this doesn't already have. Passing this method a value that would return false if passed to this object's canCombine method will throw an IllegalArgumentException.
        Parameters:
        status - the status to combine with.

      • removeDuration

        public final boolean removeDuration(java.time.Duration amount)
        Decrements the time remaining by the amount of time given. If the result decreases the time remaining to zero, the status informs the owner to remove the status. If the status has multiple stacks of varying duration, all stacks decrement equally and any stacks with no remaining time are removed. Status objects that are infinite in duration are unchanged by calls to this method.
        Parameters:
        amount - the amount of time to remove. Cannot be negative.
        Returns:
        true if the method caused a successful event, such as the successful removal of this status from its owner.

      • removeStacks

        public final void removeStacks(int amount)
        Decrements the stack size by the amount given. If the result decreases the stack size to zero, the status informs the owner to remove the status. If the status has multiple stacks of varying duration, the stacks with the longest duration are removed first.
        Parameters:
        amount - the amount of stacks to remove. Cannot be negative.

      • equals

        public final boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Returns true if the object is an instance of Status and the name value of this status and the assumed status are equal. This is to ensure that Fighter objects fail to apply a status with a duplicate name and attempt to combine them instead.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        obj - the status to test equality with.
        Returns:
        true if the given status is equivalent.
